edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.delegation.servlet

Interface TransactionFilter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAccessTokenServlet, AbstractAccessTokenServlet2, AbstractAuthorizationServlet, AbstractAuthorizationServletImpl, AbstractCertServlet, AbstractInitServlet, AbstractRegistrationServlet, AbstractVerifierServlet, AccessTokenServlet, ACS2, ACS2Impl, ActiveTokenServlet, AuthorizationControllerServlet, AuthorizedServlet, AutoRegistrationServlet, BearerTokenServlet, CertServlet, CRServlet, DiscoveryServlet, ErrorServlet, InitServlet, MultiAuthServlet, MyProxyDelegationServlet, OA2AdminRegistrationServlet, OA2AuthorizedServlet, OA2AutoRegistrationServlet, OA2CertServlet, OA2DiscoveryServlet, OA2RegistrationServlet, RegistrationServlet, RFC7009, RFC7662, TokenManagerServlet, UserInfoServlet

    public interface TransactionFilter
    A Filter pattern for working with servlets. Every servlet that can/does work with transactions will invoke these methods as needed. Do recall that the servlet will still have all the machinery from its AbstractEnvironment available.

    Created by Jeff Gaynor
    on 4/23/12 at 4:39 PM

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void postprocess(TransactionState transactionState)
      Invoked after the response has been written to the HttpServletResponse stream.
      void preprocess(TransactionState transactionState)
      Invoked after the transaction state has been determined, but before writing any response

      • postprocess

        void postprocess(TransactionState transactionState)
          throws Throwable
        Invoked after the response has been written to the HttpServletResponse stream. This is the very last call made by the servlet before returning.
        Parameters:
        transactionState -
        Throws:
        Throwable
